summary: The Community Parks Revitalization Act (HR 4985) authorizes the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to establish a program to revitalize communities through investments in parks, recreational areas, and programs. It provides grants for rehabilitation, construction, and innovative programs, including secured loans and loan guarantees for infrastructure development. The bill prioritizes projects addressing health, economic development, conservation, and youth programs, while promoting environmental responsibility and community involvement. It also includes provisions for definitions, regulations, and reports to Congress.
